alert.note: Alert for Prince of Wales Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 24 at 5:59AM AKST until December 24 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL FOR PARTS OF SE AK THROUGH CHRISTMAS... The first frontal band is over the far northern panhandle as of 5am. A break between fronts over the central panhandle where very light snow is happening with little accumulation. To the south, the second frontal band is progressing northward across Prince of Wales. This band will reach the Juneau area in the late afternoon, then weaken. A chance of freezing rain remains possible for some of the south-central outflow areas that remain below freezing Saturday. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected and light freezing rain possible. Storm total snow accumulations of 4 to 10 inches. * WHERE...Prince of Wales Island, greatest amounts over the eastern communities. * WHEN...Until 3 PM AKST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. Possible power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...4 to 8 inches of snowfall have already been reported as of Friday evening. Snowfall rates will begin to decrease Friday evening then increase over eastern Prince of Wales and again early Saturday morning. A period of light freezing rain is possible Saturday before a change over to all rain. Northern Prince of Wales and the upper portions of the highways will see the change to rain last.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
